write_up: A lot of people like the subjective idea of ballads, just like people like the subjective idea of musicals, as packets of wonderful and protracted human emotion. I’ve never been the type; I prefer hooks and catchiness more than I like the good-natured giddiness of movies like ‘Mamma Mia’. On the Sea is the only time I’ve felt that I could really share that joy. It is plainly a legendary and canonical epic of feeling, a song that only really exists so listeners can soak in it, over and over.
